columns.name: BoroName
columns.description: The name of the borough where the seating feature was installed

columns.name: BoroCode
columns.description: The one digit borough code number where the seating feature was installed.

columns.name: BoroCD
columns.description: The three digit number that represents the borough and the community district.

columns.name: CounDist
columns.description: The Council District where the seating feature was installed

columns.name: AssemDist
columns.description: The Assembly District where the seating feature was installed

columns.name: StSenDist
columns.description: The State Senate District where the seating feature was installed.

columns.name: CongDist
columns.description: The Congressional District where the seating feature was installed

columns.name: StopName
columns.description: The location or street intersection associated with the bus stop

columns.name: Corner
columns.description: The compass direction the bus stop is facing.

columns.name: BusStopID
columns.description: The six (6) digit unique identification code assigned to the bus stop by the MTA.

columns.name: Routes
columns.description: The bus route(s) that stops at the bus stop.

columns.name: Direction
columns.description: The compass direction the bus travel towards.

columns.name: Notes
columns.description: Comments on the status and additional location information for the RTPI installations.

fields.name: Agency

view.description: The Department of Transportation (DOT) replaces standard bus sign poles with Real Time Passenger Information (RTPI) bus signs at numerous locations throughout New York City. The project's initiative is to update the visual look of the current bus stop pole flag design by adding small LED screens next to each bus route that denote the number of minutes until the arrival of the next bus. Additionally, each sign includes a push-button activated audio announcement of the real-time bus arrival information.
view.emailShareUrl: mailto:?subject=Real Time Passenger Information Sign Locations&body=Here is a dataset from NYC Open Data that I would like to share with you: https%3A%2F%2Fdata.cityofnewyork.us%2FTransportation%2FReal-Time-Passenger-Information-Sign-Locations%2Fg9jx-npbk

The project's initiative is to update the visual look of the current bus stop pole flag design by adding small LED screens next to each bus route that denote the number of minutes until the arrival of the next bus. Additionally, each sign includes a push-button activated audio announcement of the real-time bus arrival information.

computedColumns.name: Zip Codes 2
computedColumns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Zip Codes' (efsh-h5xi) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

computedColumns.name: Community Districts 2
computedColumns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Community Districts' (f5dn-yrer) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

computedColumns.name: Borough Boundaries 2
computedColumns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Borough Boundaries' (yeji-bk3q) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

computedColumns.name: City Council Districts 2
computedColumns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'City Council Districts' (92fq-4b7q) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

computedColumns.name: Police Precincts 2
computedColumns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Police Precincts' (sbqj-enih) the point in column 'location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

relatedViews.name: Real Time Passenger Information Sign Locations - Map
relatedViews.description: The Department of Transportation (DOT) replaces standard bus sign poles with Real Time Passenger Information (RTPI) bus signs at numerous locations throughout New York City. The project's initiative is to update the visual look of the current bus stop pole flag design by adding small LED screens next to each bus route that denote the number of minutes until the arrival of the next bus. Additionally, each sign includes a push-button activated audio announcement of the real-time bus arrival information.
